questions.question: The Everglades ecosystem is really a wide, slow moving river.
Man-made canals contribute positively to the health of the Everglades.
The Everglades covers about 1500 acres of Southern Florida.
Tree islands in the Everglades are shaped by flowing water.
The Everglades begins just south of Orlando.
The bedrock of the Everglades is made of sandstone.
Water from Lake Okeechobee once flowed into the Kissimmee River.
The final destination of water flowing through the Everglades is Florida Bay.
